climbs.name: Seafood Platter
climbs.fa: Errett Allen, Karen Young, Bill Serniuk, Cory Hicks, 1989.

content.description:
To the right of "Opera Low Angle", the rock forms a blunt arete, of sorts.

Part way up a conspicuous plate of polish can be seen. This is Seafood Platter.

Climb up to the top of this plate Placing pro in horizontal cracks.

Then move up and left to a gold slab and climb past bolts to the top.
content.protection: Pro to 2", Draws for bolts (I don't remember how many).

content.description: Up and right of Mid Dome is a short gold cliff band with two obvious cracks, passing through a small roof. Climb the right one.

This is the leftmost bolts route on Mid Dome.  Though rated at 5.9, but you'd better be a 5.10 climber in order to lead this run out route.  This is a face climb up a less than vertical slippery and barely featured slab.

The slabby section below the first bolt is definately 5.9, and that's only if you cheat in from the crack system to the left of the bolt.  Climbing directly up to the bolt is probably a 5.10a if not harder.  Continue up on sustained featured rock for about 80 feet, and after that the climbing gets considerably simpler.

Continue up until you find something that you want to use as an anchor, and exit the route up and left off the dome.
content.protection: 2 bolts that have seen better days.  Use slings or pro to belay the follower from above using any of the crack, rock or tree systems on the less vertical top section of the slab.

climbs.name: Puppet Master
climbs.fa: Errett Allen, Karen Young, Bill Serniuk, 1988.

content.description:
This route is to the right of "Hoser" and left of a left facing corner on the edge of the slab.

Climb past three bolts to the top.

A ways to the right of the "Country Boy" area, one will notice an obvious, low angle, Chimney/flake with a nice hand crack, leading up to it.

This is "Opera Low Angle".

Climb the hand crack, then chimney behind the flake to the top.

The flake can also be liebacked.

climbs.name: McHammer
climbs.fa: Cory Hicks, Bill Serniuk, Karen Young, 1988.

content.description:
Climb the the initial crack of "Opera Low Angle" until you can move up the face to the right.

Climb past three bolts to a blunt arete. Follow this for 30-40'(5.9/10, no pro), to a fixed pin (may be gone). Continue to the top.

It is possible to get severly injured on this route! It may be considered X these days.
content.protection: Draws, some small cams. I don't remember very well.

content.description: Top rope the face just left of "I Cut My Hair".

climbs.name: Hoser
climbs.fa: Errett Allen, Karen Young and Bill (Blitzo) Serniuk

content.description:
This route ascends the right side of a large flake-like pillar  on the left side of Mid Dome.  Look for the pillar, and then several bolts on a face above the pillar.

Climb the left side of the 30' pillar, and then attack the lightly featured slab face directly above the pillar. Climbing left from the top of this pillar is another (barely) bolted route,  known as figth fire with fire (5.11a).  After the 3rd bolt, holds dissappear entirely and the crux is getting up this blank face to a seam that runs horizontally across the face.  After the seam the route is still blank, and REALLY run out, but climbing isn't as difficult due to a decrease in angle.

Walk off to the left, or belay someone from either the cracks or a tree.  You'll need a 60 meter rope to belay from the tree and some long slings.
content.protection: A couple of small ~.5-1.5" cams for the initial crack, and gear (or slings) of any size for an anchor up top. 3 bolts also protect the face climbing.

climbs.name: Fight Fire with Fire
climbs.fa: Al (Dude) Swanson, Dave Hatchett and Bill (Blitzo) Serniuk. 1987.

content.description:
Starts left of "Hoser", near center of the slab.

Follows four bolts to the top.

Crux is at the fourth bolt.

Follows face just right of "Rawl Will".

Climb up to a short shallow corner with a bolt.

Run it to the top.

A ways to the right of "Hoser", are two distinct, black water streaks.

To the left of these is a flake/corner. Climb up the corner to a protrusion, then move out and left, and up to a ledge. Follow 5 bolts up beautiful rock.
This route climbs the face between the two black streaks, to the right of "Country Boy".
Climb the face to the left of "Country Boy", past five bolts.
